column4: If the synergy package is here (http://packages.ubuntu.com/dapper/net/synergy) why can't I use apt-get to install it?
using dapper drake?
I guess so... Codename: dapper ; 6.06
Description: Ubuntu 6.06 LTS
you can use sudo apt-get update? are the repos still online?
they are... yet.
should I upgrade my install? I just had it installed just now... from a netinstaller cd
apt-cache search synergy  will show you the correct name for using with sudo apt-get install
a fresh installation.
just now? its 3 years old
:( I just downloaded it ...
why not using ubuntu 9.04 or 8.04 LTS?
can I just upgrade it ... or should I get a fresh installation cd ? I want to do a netinstaller... so I downloaded one, burned it and installed it...
I used mini.iso from the net that I downloaded....
if 6.06 is a fresh install, just reinstall with a newer version and dont use upgrade
you can download the same for 8.04 and 9.04
is there a netinstaller for that too?
ok ... let me check :)
http://ftp.telfort.nl/ubuntu-releases/9.04/ where is the net installer version?
try searching, i am at work and cant use a browser. but at the ubuntu-mirror-lists there are netinstall-images
will do ... 10x
found? maybe try google  ubuntu 9.04 netinstall image. i cant use a browser here so i cant really help
don't sweat it... :) I'll google around... I'll find it...
